definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Chapelle demands that Mason immediately end the situation at the facility.
sentences.chinese: 薛潘要求梅森立即终结拘留所的状况。

sentences.english: Parker is in federal custody facing three drug-related charges.
sentences.chinese: 帕克在联邦拘留所面临三个有关毒品的指控。

sentences.english: He spent an anxious day in the lockup.
sentences.chinese: 他在拘留所里焦急地煎熬了一天。

sentences.english: He had a gun, and they took him into custody.
sentences.chinese: 他有一支枪，他们带他去了拘留所。

sentences.english: From the Procureur Nekhludoff went straight to the preliminary detention prison.
sentences.chinese: 聂赫留朵夫从检察官那里出来，乘车直奔拘留所。

sentences.english: He absconded from a remand home.
sentences.chinese: 他从青少年拘留所潜逃了。

sentences.english: And they laid hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
sentences.chinese: 下手拿住宗徒，把他们押在公共拘留所内。

sentences.english: You can see even more lock-ups and variations here.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到更多的拘留所和变化在这里。

sentences.english: I was an interrogator at the detention facility in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是一位古巴关塔那摩湾拘留所的审讯官。

sentences.english: He was held in custody for selling fake certificates.
sentences.chinese: 他因卖假证件而被带入拘留所。

sentences.english: The officer said he’d have to put me in jail.
sentences.chinese: 那个警官说他只能把我关到拘留所里。

definition: to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
in custody/to keep sb in detention
criminal court/abbr. for 刑事法庭[xing2 shi4 fa3 ting2]
